member.name: M:SmartXLS.WorkBook.deleteRange(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int16)
member.summary: Deletes cells, rows, or columns from the specified selected sheets.
member.param: Coordinate specifying the beginning row of the range.
Coordinate specifying the beginning column of the range.
Coordinate specifying the ending row of the range.
Coordinate specifying the ending column of the range. Rows are indexed from top to bottom beginning with 0. Sheets and columns are indexed from left to right beginning with 0.

shift direction. ShiftHorizontal Shifts cells horizontally beyond the last column, one cell to the right. ShiftVertical Shifts cells vertically beyond the last row, one cell up. ShiftRows Shifts all cells beyond the last row, up to the first deleted row. ShiftColumns Shifts all cells beyond the last column to the left.
member.throws: Exception if a parameter is invalid.

member.name: P:SmartXLS.WorkBook.ConditionalFormats
member.summary: Returns the conditional formats for the current selection. this method returns an array of conditonal formats for the current selection. if all of the cells in the current selection do not have the same conditional formats, an array of one conditional format is returned and this conditional format has the type and operator set to eTypeNone and eOperatorNone. if there are no conditional formats on any of the cells, an array of length zero is returned. The conditional formats returned are copies of the actual conditional formats, and may be modified for passing back to setConditionalFormats.

member.name: T:SmartXLS.LOGFONT
member.summary: Represents LogFont structure that defines the attributes of a font.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height, in logical units, of the font's character cell or character. The character height value (also known as the em height) is the character cell height value minus the internal-leading value.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfWidth
member.summary: Specifies the average width, in logical units, of characters in the font. If lfWidth is zero, the aspect ratio of the device is matched against the digitization aspect ratio of the available fonts to find the closest match, determined by the absolute value of the difference.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfEscapement
member.summary: Specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between the escapement vector and the x-axis of the device. The escapement vector is parallel to the base line of a row of text.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between each character's base line and the x-axis of the device.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfWeight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of the font in the range 0 through 1000. For example, 400 is normal and 700 is bold. If this value is zero, a default weight is used.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfItalic
member.summary: Specifies an italic font if set to TRUE.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfUnderline
member.summary: Specifies an underlined font if set to TRUE.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfStrikeOut
member.summary: Specifies a strikeout font if set to TRUE.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfCharSet
member.summary: Specifies the character set. The following values are predefined.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfOutPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the output precision. The output precision defines how closely the output must match the requested font's height, width, character orientation, escapement, pitch, and font type.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfClipPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the clipping precision. The clipping precision defines how to clip characters that are partially outside the clipping region.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfQuality
member.summary: Specifies the output quality. The output quality defines how carefully the graphics device interface (GDI) must attempt to match the logical-font attributes to those of an actual physical font.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfPitchAndFamily
member.summary: Specifies the pitch and family of the font. The two low-order bits specify the pitch of the font. Font families describe the look of a font in a general way. They are intended for specifying fonts when the exact typeface desired is not available.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.LOGFONT.lfFaceName
member.summary: A null-terminated string that specifies the typeface name of the font. The length of this string must not exceed 32 characters, including the terminating null character. The EnumFontFamiliesEx function can be used to enumerate the typeface names of all currently available fonts. If lfFaceName is an empty string, GDI uses the first font that matches the other specified attributes.

member.name: T:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat
member.summary: This class represents a conditional format condition and the associated formatting. Conditional cell formats are formats that are applied to a cell only when the value of a cell or formula meets a predetermined set of conditions. A range of cells can be formatted with up to three conditional formats. Conditional formats may inclued font colors and styles and cell border colors, styles and patterns.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eTypeNone
member.summary: No condition type.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eTypeCell
member.summary: Condition has a type of "Cell". This causes the cell to be compared to the appropriate formula using the specified operator.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eTypeFormula
member.summary: Condition has a type of "Formula". The first formula is evaluated to determine whether to apply the format. The operator is ignored.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorNone
member.summary: No operator.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorBetween
member.summary: The format is applied if the cell is greater than or equal to formula1 and less than or equal to formula2.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorNotBetween
member.summary: The format is applied if the cell is less than formula1 or greater than formula2.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorEqual
member.summary: The format is applied if the cell is equal to formula1.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorNotEqual
member.summary: The format is applied if the cell is not equal to formula1.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorGreaterThan
member.summary: The format is applied if the cell is greater than formula1.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorLessThan
member.summary: The format is applied if the cell is less than formula1.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorGreaterThanOrEqual
member.summary: The format is applied if the cell is greater than or equal to formula1.

member.name: F:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.eOperatorLessThanOrEqual
member.summary: The format is applied if the cell is less than or equal to formula1.

member.name: M:SmartXLS.ConditionFormat.getFormula1(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the first formula associated with this conditional format
member.param: the row this formula is relative to.
the column this formula is relative to.
member.returns: the formula. Returns null if there is no formula.
